short-title.#text:
Hill Creek Cultural Preservation and
			 Energy Development Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , as amended by the Act entitled

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
An Act to define the exterior boundary of the Uintah and Ouray Indian
			 Reservation in the State of Utah, and for other purposes
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: An Act to define the exterior boundary of the Uintah and Ouray Indian Reservation in the State of Utah, and for other purposes

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is further amended by adding at the end the
			 following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
An Act to
			 amend the Act extending the exterior boundary of the Uintah and Ouray Indian
			 Reservation in the State of Utah so as to authorize such State to exchange
			 certain mineral lands for other lands mineral in character
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: An Act to amend the Act extending the exterior boundary of the Uintah and Ouray Indian Reservation in the State of Utah so as to authorize such State to exchange certain mineral lands for other lands mineral in character

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(approved March
				11, 1948) and south of the border between Grand County, Utah, and Uintah
				County, Utah, and select in lieu of such relinquished lands, on an
				acre-for-acre basis, any subsurface mineral lands of the United States located
				beneath the surface estate delineated in

(approved March 11,
				1948) and north of the border between Grand County, Utah, and Uintah County,
				Utah, subject to the following conditions:

text.#text:
In order to further clarify authorizations
				under this Act, the State of Utah is hereby authorized to relinquish to the
				United States, for the benefit of the Ute Indian Tribe of the Uintah and Ouray
				Reservation, State school trust or other State-owned subsurface mineral lands
				located beneath the surface estate delineated in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall reserve an overriding interest in that portion of the
				mineral estate comprised of minerals subject to leasing under the

in any mineral lands conveyed to the
				State.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: An Act to define the exterior boundary of the Uintah and Ouray Indian Reservation in the State of Utah, and for other purposes/s:5/p:1

text.#text:
The overriding interest reserved by the
				United States under

a 6.25 percent
				overriding royalty on the gross proceeds of oil and gas production under any
				lease or authorization to develop such oil and gas resources; and

an overriding
				royalty on the gross proceeds of production of such minerals other than oil and
				gas, equal to 50 percent of the royalty rate established by the

The State of
				Utah shall reserve, for the benefit of its State school trust, an overriding
				interest in that portion of the mineral estate comprised of minerals subject to
				leasing under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in any mineral
				lands relinquished by the State to the United States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: An Act to define the exterior boundary of the Uintah and Ouray Indian Reservation in the State of Utah, and for other purposes/s:5/p:3

text.#text:
The overriding interest reserved by the State
				under

50 percent of any
				bonus bid or other payment received by the United States as consideration for
				securing any lease or authorization to develop such mineral resources on the
				relinquished lands;

a 6.25 percent
				overriding royalty on the gross proceeds of oil and gas production under any
				lease or authorization to develop such oil and gas resources; and

an overriding
				royalty on the gross proceeds of production of such minerals other than oil and
				gas, equal to 50 percent of the royalty rate established by the

Neither the United States nor the State shall be obligated
				to lease or otherwise develop oil and gas resources in which the other party
				retains an overriding interest under this section.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized to enter
				into cooperative agreements with the State and the Ute Indian Tribe of the
				Uintah and Ouray Reservation to facilitate the relinquishment and selection of
				lands to be conveyed under this section, and the administration of the
				overriding interests reserved
				hereunder.

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

		  Indian Reservation in the State of Utah, and for other
		  purposes

official-title.#text:
To clarify authority granted under the Act
		  entitled

			 Resources
